intro: Haplophloga loucoubensis, commonly known as the Loucoubé sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of West Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, an adaptation to its harsh environment. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
